_header: As I fared through a forest free / There birds song from year to year
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 182.
Subjects: advice, moral; transitoriness, of world; birds, as speakers/narrators
_description: On the transitoriness of worldly fortune — seven 8-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Welfare hath no sikernes’

OxfBal354.First Lines:
As I fared thorow a forest freeTher byrdis song from yere to
                    yere…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…To blis God bryng vs at owr last dayFor welfare hath no
                    sikernesExplicit
OxfBal354.Note:
A first attempt at the top of p. 430 omits some lines and is marked for
                    deletion with a large “X” struck through the lines.
